details.title: Constant-False-Alarm-Rate Processors for Locally Nonstationary Clutter
details.abstract: A technique for designing normalizing processors for locally non-stationary clutter is discussed. The design procedure assumes the logarithm of the clutter power varies as a polynomial with range. When the actual environment matches the design environment, the false-alarm rate is a constant that is independent of the polynomial coefficients. A measure of the relative target detection capability as a function of the number of normalization cells and the degree of the design-environment polynomial is given. The applicability of the processors to non-Rayleigh clutter is discussed.
details.journal_title: IEEE Transactions on Aerospace and Electronic Systems
